intro: Thesium ambiguum, commonly known as the ambiguous thesium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, cylindrical inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slightly hairy surface. Thesium ambiguum is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
